ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: So pray to your Lord and sacrifice.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: So serve your Lord with full dedication and sacrifice.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: So offer Prayer and sacrifice to your Lord alone.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: So worship your Lord and make sacrificial offerings.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: So offer the prayers for your Lord, and perform the sacrifice.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Therefore turn in prayer to your Lord and sacrifice.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Therefore pray to your Lord and make a sacrifice.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: so pray unto thy Lord and sacrifice.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: So pray unto thy Lord, and sacrifice.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Pray to your Lord and sacrifice to Him alone.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Wherefore pray thou Unto thy Lord, and sacrifice.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: So pray to your Lord, and sacrifice [the sacrificial camel].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Therefore to thy Lord turn in Prayer and Sacrifice.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Therefore turn in prayer to your Lord and sacrifice (to Him only).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: So pray to your Lord and sacrifice.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: So pray to your Lord and sacrifice.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: So pray to your Lord and sacrifice [to Him alone].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [108:2] So pray to your Lord, the prayer of the Festival of Immolation (‘īd al-nahr), and sacrifice, your offering.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (So pray unto thy Lord) in gratitude for that, (and sacrifice) face towards the Qiblah when immolating your sacrifice; it is also said this means: put your right hand on the left hand when in prayer; and it is also said this means: complete your bowing and prostration such that your upper part of the chest is plain; and it is also said that this means: pray to your Lord on the day of immolation and offer a sacrifice. 775
